Package nl.han.ica.oopg.view

Class Viewport

java.lang.Object
nl.han.ica.oopg.view.Viewport
Direct Known Subclasses:
FollowingViewport
public class Viewport
extends java.lang.Object
The viewport controls what is displayed of the drawn world.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Viewport​(int x, int y, int zoomWidth, int zoomHeight)
    Create a new Viewport object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Viewport

      public Viewport​(int x, int y, int zoomWidth, int zoomHeight)
      Create a new Viewport object.
      Parameters:
      x - The x index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.
      y - The y index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.
      zoomWidth - The width in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.
      zoomHeight - The height in pixels which the viewPort will cut out of the world.

  • Method Details

    • createImage

      public processing.core.PImage createImage​(processing.core.PGraphics worldGraphics)
      The method which is called to cut out an image of the drawn world.
      Parameters:
      worldGraphics - The canvas which represents the world from which the viewPort will cut its image out of.
      Returns:
      The cut out image of the world.

    • getX

      public java.lang.Integer getX()
      Gets the x location of the Viewport.
      Returns:
      The x index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.

      public void setX​(java.lang.Integer x)
      Sets the x location of the Viewport.
      Parameters:
      x - The x index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.

    • getY

      public java.lang.Integer getY()
      Gets the y location of the Viewport.

      The y index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.

    • setY

      public void setY​(java.lang.Integer y)
      Sets the y location of the Viewport.
      Parameters:
      y - The y index of the topLeft corner from where the viewPort will cut its image out of the world.

    • setZoomSize

      public void setZoomSize​(int zoomWidth, int zoomHeight)

      Parameters:
